metadata.title: CVE-2017-17997 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In Wireshark before 2.2.12, the MRDISC dissector misuses a NULL pointer andcrashes. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-mrdisc.c byvalidating an IPv4 address. This vulnerability is similar to CVE-2017-9343.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17997` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1').
